content:
• Friday, May 18, 2012
  • CALL

    MagicJack VocalTec (NASDAQ:CALL) -1.9% AH after disclosing CEO Dan Borislow sold 1M shares to...

    MagicJack VocalTec (NASDAQ:CALL) -1.9% AH after disclosing CEO Dan Borislow sold 1M shares to the company's president, chairman, and 3 shareholders for liquidity purposes. It adds the deal "would enable Mr. Borislow to not have personal debt tied to his stock."

     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • AEO

    American Eagle (NYSE:AEO) CFO Joan Hilson is stepping down. An active search for a successor is...

    American Eagle (NYSE:AEO) CFO Joan Hilson is stepping down. An active search for a successor is currently underway. Hilson will work with the company through the end of July to ensure an orderly transition. Effective immediately, VP Scott Hurd will lead day-to-day management of the finance team, and assume the roles of interim principal accounting officer and interim principal financial officer until a successor is appointed. Shares +3.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +0.6%) closes at $38.23 following an epic final hour of trading. Shares spent an...

    Facebook (FB +0.6%) closes at $38.23 following an epic final hour of trading. Shares spent an enormous amount of time between $38 and $38.05, without ever breaking below the IPO price. Underwriters are widely seen as responsible for the support (I, II, III), though their apparent efforts couldn't prevent the NASDAQ from falling 1.2%, or a general bloodbath from occurring among social networking and other Facebook-related stocks.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 13 Comments
  • RAVN

    Raven Industries (RAVN +10.4%) leaps today after its Q1 blew away EPS and revenue estimates on...

    Raven Industries (RAVN +10.4%) leaps today after its Q1 blew away EPS and revenue estimates on record sales and earnings. Net profit rose 21% Y/Y, driven by a solid increase in operating income and double-digit sales gains in its Engineered Films and Applied Technology Divisions.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM

  • Stocks sink to session lows 30 minutes before the bell as Facebook trades back down to its offer...

    Stocks sink to session lows 30 minutes before the bell as Facebook trades back down to its offer price of $38 (where, presumably it's getting massive support from the underwriters). S&P 500 -0.8%, Nasdaq -1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • MRTN

    Marten Transport (MRTN +5.3%) gets a pop after Stifel Nicolaus ups the shares to Buy, saying the...

    Marten Transport (MRTN +5.3%) gets a pop after Stifel Nicolaus ups the shares to Buy, saying the company has a unique niche as the largest temperature-controlled truckload-based carriers in the U.S. hauling freight such as food, pharmaceuticals, and cosmetics - all of which tend to hold up well even as the economy experiences soft patches.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • GM

    First no Facebook, now no Super Bowl, as General Motors (GM -1.6%) decides advertising in next...

    First no Facebook, now no Super Bowl, as General Motors (GM -1.6%) decides advertising in next year's Super Bowl would prove too costly. GM is in the process of evaluating all its media properties in an effort to maximize the efficiency of its ad budget, but the automaker says it isn't cutting back; GM spent $4.47B on advertising last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 8 Comments

  • Late afternoon leak time? The euro just shot 50 pips higher to $1.2775. Stocks are improving a...

    Late afternoon leak time? The euro just shot 50 pips higher to $1.2775. Stocks are improving a bit too, S&P 500 -0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • SMT

    Smart Technologies (SMT -24%) gets hammered today after reporting an FQ4 that missed on all...

    Smart Technologies (SMT -24%) gets hammered today after reporting an FQ4 that missed on all counts. Total revenue declined 11.5% Y/Y, primarily due to a slowdown in education market sales, its largest bottom line contributor. The company also added that, due to poor visibility in its key markets, it's only able to provide directional guidance for FY13, saying revenues will decline at a higher rate than 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • UAN

    CVR Partners (UAN -4.6%) CEO Byron Kelley lays out the case for why the massive amount of...

    CVR Partners (UAN -4.6%) CEO Byron Kelley lays out the case for why the massive amount of acreage devoted to corn is not going to result in as much production as expected - all of those acres being pulled in are among the least productive. Expect ending stocks to remain low, and corn prices to remain high, along with demand for the fertilizer he sells. (h/t Dividend Master)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • DNDN

    Shares of Dendreon (DNDN -5.1%) continue their descent today after Maxim initiates coverage with...

    Shares of Dendreon (DNDN -5.1%) continue their descent today after Maxim initiates coverage with a sell rating, saying that Provenge faces logistic, manufacturing and competitive challenges that could impede sales growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 6 Comments
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (ARUN -7.3%) makes new 52-week lows after posting in-line FQ3 results and guiding...

    Aruba Networks (ARUN -7.3%) makes new 52-week lows after posting in-line FQ3 results and guiding on its earnings call for FQ4 revenue of $136M-$138M and EPS of $0.16-$0.17 (consensus is at $138.9M and $0.17. Fellow Wi-Fi equipment vendors Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT -7.6%) and NetGear (NTGR -4.1%) are also getting hit. Auriga (Buy) notes weak Euro demand is having an impact - archrival Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) reported the same, but its wireless sales were also healthy. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • MRVL

    Up yesterday after beating FQ1 estimates and delivering decent FQ2 guidance, as well as...

    Up yesterday after beating FQ1 estimates and delivering decent FQ2 guidance, as well as announcing a dividend and new buybacks, Marvell (MRVL -2.2%) is now trading lower. Judging by how hard drive controller customers Seagate (STX -4.3%) and Western Digital (WDC -5.5%) are also selling off, the Street may have wanted hard drive demand to drive more FQ2 upside. Nomura (Reduce) is worried about the margin impact of a mix shift towards mobile baseband chips. (transcript) (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • ZNGA

    Facebook's weaker-than-expected IPO is producing a tumultuous day for Zynga (ZNGA -5.7%). Shares...

    Facebook's weaker-than-expected IPO is producing a tumultuous day for Zynga (ZNGA -5.7%). Shares fell 13.3% before being halted on circuit breakers. They subsequently rebounded a bit, but were halted again, and have remained that way since 12:29 ET. Update (1:44 ET): Shares have resumed trading, and are now down 8.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 5 Comments
  • AAP

    Shares of Advance Auto Parts (AAP -0.6%) continue to falter despite a spirited defense from...

    Shares of Advance Auto Parts (AAP -0.6%) continue to falter despite a spirited defense from Raymond James. Though shares have tailed off 17.7% following the firm's lackluster Q1 report, analyst Daniel Wewer stays bullish with a reiterated Strong Buy rating - undeterred by AAP execs saying that April's business saw a "meaningful slowdown."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • SYY

    Sysco (SYY -1.9%) slides on a downgrade to Underweight at Barclays, based on high food...

    Sysco (SYY -1.9%) slides on a downgrade to Underweight at Barclays, based on high food inflation, aggressive competitor pricing, and lack of dividend growth. the firm also lowers its price target to $27 from $28.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • NXGN

    Quality Systems (QSII -2.3%) slips on a downgrade to Market Perform at Leerink Swann. The firm...

    Quality Systems (QSII -2.3%) slips on a downgrade to Market Perform at Leerink Swann. The firm cites concerns that growth will slow after management said the number of signed contracts declined to 75 from 128 last quarter. The firm also lowered its price target to $31 from $45 - $47.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy (BTU -2.5%) leases 402M tons of ultra low sulfur coal reserves in the Southern...

    Peabody Energy (BTU -2.5%) leases 402M tons of ultra low sulfur coal reserves in the Southern Powder River Basin in Wyoming after submitting a winning bid of $1.11 per mineable ton. BTU now controls 3.3B tons of coal reserves in the Basin; the leased reserves lie adjacent to its North Antelope Rochelle Mine, from where it shipped 109M tons of coal in 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • FB

    After falling all the way to its IPO price of $38, Facebook (FB +8.9%) has bounced, and is now...

    After falling all the way to its IPO price of $38, Facebook (FB +8.9%) has bounced, and is now trading at $41.37. That's helped the NASDAQ, down ~1% at one point, head back towards breakeven. Zero Hedge notes over 30M shares traded at $38. "That's some serious underwriter buying," it quips.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 17 Comments
  • OMX

    OfficeMax (OMX +1.9%) and Office Depot (ODP +1.4%) trade higher as Staples (SPLS -1.1%) slumps...

    OfficeMax (OMX +1.9%) and Office Depot (ODP +1.4%) trade higher as Staples (SPLS -1.1%) slumps again. While all three office supply sellers race to downsize and increase e-commerce sales, it's a weak Europe and the threat of Amazon's new B2B site that weighs on SPLS a bit more heavy than on its peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • AZO

    AutoZone (AZO +1.7%) moves higher on an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Credit Suisse. The...

    AutoZone (AZO +1.7%) moves higher on an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Credit Suisse. The firm cites solid EPS growth and secular drivers that should boost sales, include an aging vehicle fleet and the high miles driven.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSN

    Samson Oil & Gas (SSN +5.6%) shares move up after the company provides an operational...

    Samson Oil & Gas (SSN +5.6%) shares move up after the company provides an operational advisory on current projects. It says the Spirit of America #2 well has been drilled to the intermediate casing point of 9,140 ft., 70 ft. deeper than the point at which the first well was abandoned, prior to penetrating two 3D seismically defined targets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • ADSK

    Soft Q2 guidance is hammering Autodesk (ADSK -15%) post-earnings. During its earnings call,...

    Soft Q2 guidance is hammering Autodesk (ADSK -15%) post-earnings. During its earnings call, Autodesk claimed weak sales to EMEA and Media & Entertainment customers are hurting results; it blames the latter on a mix shift towards suites, and weak demand for Creative Finishing software. Jefferies (Buy) also notes maintenance and backlog numbers were weak, but thinks Autodesk's margin improvements and transition to a subscription-based model will drive shares higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • AUMN

    Golden Minerals (AUMN +6.5%) says the new resource estimate for its Velardena Property in...

    Golden Minerals (AUMN +6.5%) says the new resource estimate for its Velardena Property in Durango, Mexico, demonstrates significantly higher grades of ~50% on a gold/silver equivalent basis than previous estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • FB

    Facebook's (FB +3%) weaker-than-expected debut is leading to a massive selloff in...

    Facebook's (FB +3%) weaker-than-expected debut is leading to a massive selloff in Facebook-related plays, and (to a lesser extent) Internet stocks in general. ZNGA -13.3%. RENN -9.4%. GSVC -12.4%. SVVC -18.6%. P -6%. GRPN -4.9%. YELP -4.4%. QPSA -5.1%. Facebook is now changing hands at $39.12.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 14 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) opens for trading at $42, and is currently changing hands at $42.57, up 12%...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) opens for trading at $42, and is currently changing hands at $42.57, up 12% from its $38 IPO price. Update (11:35): Facebook is now trading at $40.20. Over 105M shares have been traded.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 12 Comments
  • LORL

    Loral Space Systems (LORL +1.8%) says that the Nimiq 6 satellite was successfully launched...

    Loral Space Systems (LORL +1.8%) says that the Nimiq 6 satellite was successfully launched yesterday from the Baikonur Space Center in Kazakhstan, and deployed its solar arrays early this morning according to schedule. Tomorrow it will begin firing its main thruster to maneuver into geostationary orbit.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • SATCQ

    Satcon Technology (SATC -1.2%) dips after Cantor Fitzgerald cut the shares to Hold earlier...

    Satcon Technology (SATC -1.2%) dips after Cantor Fitzgerald cut the shares to Hold earlier today. The firm cites uncertainty following the U.S. Department of Commerce's decision to impose an immediate 31% duty on Chinese-manufactured c-Si cells, modules, and panels, noting “This takes the nascent U.S. solar industry evolution out of the hands of entrepreneurs and technologists and into the hands of politicians, bureaucrats, and lawyers."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • FB

    Indications that Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) will open in the low-to-mid $40s, below the expectations...

    Indications that Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) will open in the low-to-mid $40s, below the expectations of some, have contributed to a selloff in the NASDAQ, which is now trading near breakeven. Facebook-related plays are also moving lower. GSVC -3.8%. SVVC -9.3%. ZNGA -2.4%. RENN -7.4%. Trading has been delayed, but is expected to begin in minutes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 3 Comments
  • HNP

    Huaneng Power (HNP +3.4%) moves up after Citigroup ups the shares to Buy. Citi says that after...

    Huaneng Power (HNP +3.4%) moves up after Citigroup ups the shares to Buy. Citi says that after conducting channel checks, it believes the utility will benefit from cheaper coal costs and a high coal inventory. The firm adds that freight rates, representing 15% of coal cost, have also fallen by 18% - 31% since early April.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • FB

    With trading set to begin in minutes, indications are that Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) will begin...

    With trading set to begin in minutes, indications are that Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) will begin trading at $45, $7 above its $38 offering price. 46M shares have reportedly been paired.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • FSLR

    A day after American and Chinese solar stocks went in opposite directions thanks to the U.S....

    A day after American and Chinese solar stocks went in opposite directions thanks to the U.S. government's imposition of anti-dumping duties on Chinese solar imports, the entire group is trading lower (TAN -2.1%), perhaps due to investors focusing on the huge oversupply and pricing issues facing industry players regardless of location. Among the big losers: FSLR -3.5%. STP -3.8%. SPWR -5.2%. YGE -6.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 2 Comments
  • TUP

    Tupperware Brands (TUP -1%) slips after Argus cut the shares to Hold, saying it expects the...

    Tupperware Brands (TUP -1%) slips after Argus cut the shares to Hold, saying it expects the company to continue to post disappointing results in developed markets and for higher resin costs and foreign exchange to put pressure on earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • GSVC

    GSV Capital (GSVC -1.2%) and the Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC -3.1%), each of which...

    GSV Capital (GSVC -1.2%) and the Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC -3.1%), each of which have invested in Facebook ahead of its IPO, are trading lower ahead of Facebook's 11 A.M. ET open. GSVC is now down 11% on the week. Is this a sign investors are fretting about Facebook's post-IPO performance, or just that speculators are choosing to play it safe and cash out?
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • DCI

    Donaldson (DCI +1.5%) ticks higher after beating FQ3 estimates this morning on record revenue....

    Donaldson (DCI +1.5%) ticks higher after beating FQ3 estimates this morning on record revenue. Net earnings rose 15% Y/Y on improved margins. The company also raised its FY12 earnings estimate by $0.03 to between $1.66 - $1.76 a share and revised its sales forecast by 9% to $2.5B. Its February guidance was for 7% to 12% sales growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • GSS

    Golden Star Resources (GSS -11%) shares sink to a 52-week low after entering into a debenture...

    Golden Star Resources (GSS -11%) shares sink to a 52-week low after entering into a debenture purchase and exchange agreement. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • CRM

    Estimates rise and bullish commentary abounds following Salesforce.com's (CRM +10.1%) strong FQ1...

    Estimates rise and bullish commentary abounds following Salesforce.com's (CRM +10.1%) strong FQ1 report, featuring another quarter of surging deferred revenue, free cash flow, and sales expenses. Credit Agricole is upgrading shares to Buy, and Nomura (Buy) notes billings growth rose 34% in spite of concerns about weakness. During its earnings call, Salesforce noted Gartner now believes the company is the world's #2 CRM software vendor, ahead of ORCL and behind SAP.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 3 Comments
  • KIRK

    Shares of Kirkland's (KIRK -14.6%) sink after the company's Q1 earnings report is in-line with...

    Shares of Kirkland's (KIRK -14.6%) sink after the company's Q1 earnings report is in-line with the consensus estimates of analysts, but highlights the home decor retailer's woes. A promotional environment in the sector and weak same-store sales are proving to be a major challenge, as the company cuts its full-year EPS forecast to $.87-$0.97 from prior guidance of $1.10-$1.15.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • NKE

    A powerful earnings report from Foot Locker is enough to help prop up shares of Nike (NKE...

    A powerful earnings report from Foot Locker is enough to help prop up shares of Nike (NKE +2.5%). Strong sales at the company are a good indicator that Nike's new products are resonating with consumers and flying off the shelves.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • SCHN

    Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -6.5%) opens sharply lower after warning of weakness ahead, as demand for...

    Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -6.5%) opens sharply lower after warning of weakness ahead, as demand for recycled metals remains soft while supplies are tight. D.A. Davidson downgrades shares to Underperform with a $26 price target, down from $40, as "softening market/pricing conditions since early April appear to have more than offset positive trends experienced earlier in the quarter."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • HDY

    Hyperdynamics (HDY +4.9%) faces being booted from the NYSE after the oil and gas explorer is...

    Hyperdynamics (HDY +4.9%) faces being booted from the NYSE after the oil and gas explorer is slapped with a warning over its continued weak share price. HDY's market cap fell from ~$800M in March to ~$150M in April, driven by a failure to find commercial volumes of oil at its Sabu-1 wildcat off Guinea.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • CAL

    Brown Shoe (BWS +7.1%) soars after smashing the estimates of analysts with its Q1 report and...

    Brown Shoe (BWS +7.1%) soars after smashing the estimates of analysts with its Q1 report and raising its outlook for FY12. Though an early Easter drove shoe sales higher during the period, the firm's effective cost management appears to be tipping sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) hasn't begun trading in the U.S. yet, but in Germany, bids of €58.20...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) hasn't begun trading in the U.S. yet, but in Germany, bids of €58.20 ($74) are being placed, according to Bloomberg. That nearly amounts to a doubling from the company's $38 IPO price, and would translate into a market cap north of $200B.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 14 Comments
  • MUX

    McEwen Mining (NYSE:MUX) CEO Robert McEwen sees an ultimate target price for gold at $5,000/oz....

    McEwen Mining (NYSE:MUX) CEO Robert McEwen sees an ultimate target price for gold at $5,000/oz. by the end of this cycle, despite current weakness in precious metals prices. On the company, uncertainty related to the repatriation of funds from the San Jose mine could impair its ability to internally finance its projects. MUX +4.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • FL

    Shares of Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) pick up more steam in premarket trading following the company's...

    Shares of Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) pick up more steam in premarket trading following the company's solid earnings beat, and are now up 12.8%. Key margin gains and sales momentum appear to be the rallying points for investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • FB

    Some Internet stocks deemed to be Facebook-related (NASDAQ:FB) plays are rallying yet again in...

    Some Internet stocks deemed to be Facebook-related (NASDAQ:FB) plays are rallying yet again in premarket trading, as expectations grow for a major post-IPO pop. QPSA +10%. ZNGA +1.7%. RENN +1.3%

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • WGO

    Premarket gainers: WGO +21%. FFN +14%. QPSA +11%. OSIR +10%. FL +8%. CRM +7%. NBG +6%. YHOO +5%....

    Premarket gainers: WGO +21%. FFN +14%. QPSA +11%. OSIR +10%. FL +8%. CRM +7%. NBG +6%. YHOO +5%.
    Losers: ADSK -9%. GSS -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • WGO

    Shares of Winnebago (NYSE:WGO) skyrocket 23.3% premarket off of a report from Bloomberg that...

    Shares of Winnebago (NYSE:WGO) skyrocket 23.3% premarket off of a report from Bloomberg that North Street has made a $11-a-share offer to buy the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (NYSE:MM) may be continuing to bounce back from its dismal Q1 report, with...

    Millennial Media (NYSE:MM) may be continuing to bounce back from its dismal Q1 report, with shares +4.1% premarket after Goldman Sachs' upgrade to Buy from Neutral. "With the stock trading at 16x 2014E EV/EBITDA vs. the internet average at 12x despite a revenue growth outlook 2.7x the sector, we believe this is an attractive entry point," the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • ANN

    More on Ann's (NYSE:ANN) Q1: Results helped by strong sales of Loft brand and significantly...

    More on Ann's (NYSE:ANN) Q1: Results helped by strong sales of Loft brand and significantly reduced promotions at Ann Taylor store. SG&E expenses flat Y/Y as a percentage of total sales. Expects 2012 total net sales of $2.375B on comparable sales growth in mid-single digits. Shares -1.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) +4% premarket as Kara Swisher reports it is in the final stages of selling a large...

    Yahoo (YHOO) +4% premarket as Kara Swisher reports it is in the final stages of selling a large chunk of its stake in Alibaba back to the Chinese company in a complex deal set to include a multibillion-dollar share buyback to YHOO investors and an eventual Alibaba IPO. A deal could be announced as early as Monday.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM | 3 Comments
  • FL

    More on Foot Locker's (NYSE:FL) Q1: Comparable-store sales +9.7%. Merchanise inventory fell 1.1%...

    More on Foot Locker's (NYSE:FL) Q1: Comparable-store sales +9.7%. Merchanise inventory fell 1.1% Y/Y to $1.146B. Total number of stores increased trimmed to 3,360 from 3,420 last year, led lower by Lady Foot Locker. Shares +1.4% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM
  • FL

    Foot Locker (NYSE:FL): Q1 EPS of $0.83 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $1.58B (+8.7% Y/Y) beats by...

    Foot Locker (NYSE:FL): Q1 EPS of $0.83 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $1.58B (+8.7% Y/Y) beats by $30M. Shares +1.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 AM
  • SAN

    Spanish stocks rebound from a sharp opening loss after rumors start to circulate about a...

    Spanish stocks rebound from a sharp opening loss after rumors start to circulate about a possible ban on short selling of banks. IBEX 35 now -0.2%. In Spain, BBVA +3.8%. In U.S. premarket, Santander (STD) +4.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 AM | 4 Comments

  • Asia-Pacific markets get hammered as Moody's downgrade of 17 Spanish banks compounds broader...

    Asia-Pacific markets get hammered as Moody's downgrade of 17 Spanish banks compounds broader eurozone fears. Japan -3.0% to 8611. Hong Kong -2.7% to 18682. China -1.5% to 2344. India -1.1% to 15898. Australia -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 AM | 2 Comments
